column4: I found sending my keystrokes and searches to third parties by default (facebook, twitter,amazon etc) very disturbing and bad anti-user practice. And I would like Canonical to stop that id it wants me to recommend Ubuntu to anyone.
I don't like it either. I think it is a necessary evil in a way.

I think it is enough to have them displayed in bottom of software center by default. but it is annoying enough to offer non-free software in free software OS. Let alone putting those on my main user interface could be classified as too much aggressive advertising, Maybe even illegal in some places.

It is not question of just revenue. It is question of my privacy being selled in main OS GUI to some third party companies directly, together with my IP address. And forcing users to watch advertising in their regular everyday work. Like Ubuntu is moving advertising OS.
